lead_paragraph: CRAWFORD--Malcolm, 85, died Friday, March 18, 2016 following a brief illness. He was born in Fayetteville, North Carolina, the son of John Reid and Pearl Bethune Crawford. Malcolm attended New Hanover High School and Duke University. Following his years as a Naval officer, he traveled throughout Europe before joining Bell Labs. He had a successful career in advertising with J. Walter Thompson and McCann Erickson. Malcolm was also an active volunteer, both at his church and as a board member of his co-op. He was predeceased by his friend Castle Campbell, his parents and siblings. He is survived by his sister-in-law Marlene Crawford, nephew, Ralph, niece, Anita and their families. A memorial service for Malcolm will be held on Friday, April 8 at 10:30am at The First Presbyterian Church in New York located at 12 West 12th Street. In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions may be made to the Jefferson Market Branch of the New York Public Library and Carnegie Hall. 1/3
